changes: s5_multi_select: Exclude. S5 is a screener with termination options (Advertising Agency, Market Research, PR, Media, Pharma Manufacturer, Regulatory Agency). Qualified sample will overwhelmingly have 'None of these' = 1, so the table is not analytically useful. Kept labels as per survey; no other changes.
s8_time_allocation: Pass through. Labels match survey S8; variables are numeric percentage fields (0-100) that sum to 100%—structure appropriate as mean_rows.

s12: Pass through. Question S12 asks respondents to enter numeric counts (0-999) for number of patients with events by time period. Labels matched survey text; table type 'mean_rows' is appropriate. Added required fields (isNet, netComponents, indent) to each row.

A1_overview: Fixed row labels to match survey answer text exactly and clarified Nexletol/Nexlizet naming. No nets, splits, or T2B applied because this is a categorical select with two answer choices per product.
a3: Pass through. Labels match the survey text for A3. Variables are numeric (0-100) counts of patients out of the last 100; no NETs, T2B or splits needed.

a3a: Labels updated to map each variable to the specific therapy from the survey (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol) and to make clear whether the value is 'In addition to statin' or 'Without a statin'. Variables themselves were not changed.

a3a: No NETs or T2B added — these are numeric percent (0-100) mean rows per therapy from A3a, so adding box-score rollups or nets would be unnecessary and would require creating new variables (not allowed). Kept tableType = mean_rows.
a3a: sourceTableId set to original tableId for traceability; table retained (not excluded).

A3b_mean_rows: Fixed row labels to map each datamap variable to the therapy named in the survey (Leqvio, Praluent, Repatha, Zetia, Nexletol/Nexlizet) and clarified the BEFORE/AFTER phrasing. No structural splits, NETs or T2B added because these are numeric % (0-100) mean rows tied to specific therapies.
a4_mean_rows: Labels clarified to reflect the two columns in the survey. Appended ' - LAST 100 patients' and ' - NEXT 100 patients' to the row labels so the combined table is unambiguous.
a4_last100_mean_rows: Added derived split (sourceTableId = a4_mean_rows) showing only the LAST 100 patient variables (A4r1c1–A4r7c1) for easier slicing by analysts.
a4_next100_mean_rows: Added derived split (sourceTableId = a4_mean_rows) showing only the NEXT 100 patient variables (A4r1c2–A4r7c2) for easier slicing by analysts.
General: No NETs or T2B added because these are numeric counts (0-100) rather than categorical/scale items. Kept variable names unchanged.

A4a_mean_rows: Labels updated to match survey wording. Replaced generic 'with statin'/'without statin' with the survey column language 'In addition to statin' and 'Without a statin', and standardized therapy names to match A4 (expanded Zetia and Nexletol/Nexlizet wording). No structural changes; kept as mean_rows for percent (0-100) variables.

A4b_mean_rows: Fixed row labels to match survey wording. Mapped c1 -> 'BEFORE any other lipid-lowering therapy (first line)' and c2 -> 'AFTER trying another lipid-lowering therapy'. No structural changes, NETs, or T2B added because variables are numeric percent allocations (0-100) per datamap.
A6_rank1: Pass through. Labels already match survey text; kept table as frequency of items ranked #1. Added required row fields (isNet, netComponents, indent) and explicit exclude/isDerived flags.
A6_rank2: Pass through. Labels were matched to the survey text. Added required metadata fields (isNet, netComponents, indent) to each row for consistency with table schema.

A6_rank3: Pass through with minor metadata fixes. Labels match the survey text and variable descriptions. Changed tableType from 'frequency' to 'ranking' (this is a rank question, values 1-4). Added required row fields (isNet=false, netComponents=[], indent=0) and set sourceTableId for traceability.
A6_rank4: Pass through. Labels match survey wording and the table correctly reports items assigned rank = 4 (least preferred). No structural changes required.

a7: Pass through. Question is a select-all (binary flags A7r1-A7r5) and labels match the survey. Changed tableType to 'multi_select' for semantic correctness; no NETs or T2B added because this is a multi-select set of binary variables.
A8_r1: Labels updated to survey language for the 1-5 likelihood scale (1=Not at all likely ... 5=Extremely likely).

A8_r1: Added Top-2-Box (Likely, filterValue '4,5') and Bottom-2-Box (Not likely, filterValue '1,2') NET rows for each product (Repatha, Praluent, Leqvio); retained full 1-5 detail rows and indented detail rows to show rollups.
A8_r1: Marked table as derived (isDerived=true) with sourceTableId set to the original table ID. Kept 'scale-5' hint.

A8_r3: Labels updated to survey language (1=Not at all likely ... 5=Extremely likely). Added Top 2 Box (T2B = 4,5) and Bottom 2 Box (B2B = 1,2) NET rows for each product (Repatha, Praluent, Leqvio) while retaining full 5-point scale. Kept hint scale-5.
A8_r5: Fixed labels to match survey language for A8 row 'Who are intolerant of statins' (1=Not at all likely ... 5=Extremely likely).
A8_r5: Added Top 2 Box rows labeled 'Likely (T2B)' (filterValue = 4,5) and Bottom 2 Box rows labeled 'Not likely (B2B)' (filterValue = 1,2) for each product (Repatha, Praluent, Leqvio).
A8_r5: Kept full 5-point scale detail rows for each product and used indentation to show which categories roll up into the nets. Marked table as derived and set sourceTableId to the original table.
a9: Fixed labels to match survey response options. Mapped values 1-4 to: 1 = No issues; 2 = Some issues; 3 = Significant issues; 4 = Haven't prescribed without a statin.
a9: Added a NET row for each product (values 2,3) labeled 'Encountered issues (NET)' to capture respondents reporting any issues (Some or Significant).
a9: Kept table as a frequency grid by product; did not split into separate product tables (single grid is the natural survey view).
a10: Converted tableType to 'multi_select' to reflect that A10 is a select-all-that-apply question per the survey.
a10: Kept labels as written in the survey (minor punctuation normalized for A10r6).
a10: Added required row metadata (isNet, netComponents, indent). Did not add NET rows because that would require inventing new variables (prohibited by constraints).

b5: Added a cross-variable NET row 'Any of the above (NET)' (netComponents: B5r1-B5r5) to provide a useful summary of respondents who selected any option.

qON_LIST_OFF_LIST: Pass through with label fixes. Expanded shorthand (CARD, PCP, NPPA) to full, clearer labels indicating role and ON-/OFF-LIST status. No nets, splits, or T2B added because this is a recruitment/admin tag.

s6_years_in_practice: Pass through. Question is a numeric open-ended 'years in practice' item. Kept tableType 'mean_rows' to report central tendency. Added required row metadata fields (isNet=false, netComponents=[], indent=0). Note: survey enforces termination for values <3 or >35, so incoming data should reflect that filter even though datamap allows 0-99.
s7: Exclude. This is a screener question where 'Part-Time' is a TERMINATE response in the survey; the analytic sample contains only Full-Time respondents, so the table would be uninformative.

s9: Pass through. Labels match the survey and datamap; structure appropriate for a single-select frequency question.

s10: Label shortened and clarified to match survey wording while keeping the full meaning. Kept table as mean_rows since S10 is a numeric open-ended question (patients managed per month). No nets, splits, or T2B added.

s11: Pass through with minor label clarification. The question is a numeric open-end (0-999) asking for a count of patients; no NETs/T2B/splitting applicable. a2a: Label fixes. Replaced encoding artifacts ('?') with the correct '≥' and ensured row labels match the survey wording. No structural changes made.
a2b: Pass through. Labels match the survey question and datamap; structure appropriate as a simple categorical frequency table.
A5: Pass through. Labels already match the survey text for the time-to-change question; no splits or NETs added (ordinal time buckets are clear).

b3: Pass through. Labels already match the survey text. Added required metadata fields (isNet, netComponents, indent) to each row.

b4: Pass through with minor label clarification. The survey question B4 is a numeric open-end asking for the number of physicians in the respondent's practice (allows 1-9999 if S2=1-5, 0-9999 if S2=6,7). Kept tableType as mean_rows. No nets, splits, or T2B rows required.
